#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Glasgow cannabis enthusiasts celebrate ' green ' on city green
#Text=Tuesday , April 22 , 2014
#Text=Coinciding with Easter Sunday , Glasgow Cannabis Social Club 's annual 420 event was held on Glasgow Green , under sunny blue skies , and overlooking the river Clyde .

#Text=Despite the city 's council attempting to revoke permission for the gathering at the last minute , police were happy for it to go-ahead with approximately a dozen officers attending in high-visibility vests .
#Text=Setting up the stalls , with the river Clyde and Adelphi distillery as a backdrop Image : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Good weather , albeit tempered with a cool breeze , saw higher numbers than the prior year 's eventImage : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Glasgow Green , in the East End is the city 's oldest parkImage : Brian McNeil .
#Text=A speaker from Law Enforcement Against Prohibition ( LEAP ) explained his organisation 's position on cannabisImage : Brian McNeil .
#Text=Police were in-attendance from early-on , with Monday 's issue of the Daily Record reporting five arrests , but no troubleImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=A section of the crowd , with the People 's Palace in the backgroundImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=One of the bands setting up to entertain the crowdImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=A neon-bright sign for the Glasgow branch of the UK Cannabis Social ClubImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=Small stall , with obvious pro-cannabis signageImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=Home-made sign for the Legalise Cannabis Campaign ScotlandImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=View of stage from partway up the hillImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=People buying refreshments from the stallImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=Several attendees wore clothing with slogans openly advocating cannabisImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=A view of the tents over the stage and stalls from across the ClydeImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=Attendees watch the stage entertainment while police look onImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=Small groups of attendees regularly walked away from watchful police once it was made clear people would be arrested and cautioned for smokingImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=View of the stage area from opposite bank of the ClydeImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=Trumpet player in one of the Reggae bands that performedImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=A small stand offered hydroponic suppliesImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=Clear view of the hemp products stallImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=Close-up of some hemp-based products on saleImage : Iain Macdonald .
#Text=The Daily Record reported five arrests were made for minor offences , likely smoking and possession of small quantities of cannabis .

#Text=Taking a less-sensational — and more accurate — line of reporting , the Monday edition of Glasgow 's Evening News stated five were referred to the Procurator Fiscal who is responsible for deciding if charges should be brought .
#Text=Official figures provided by the police were that 150 attended .
#Text=With people coming and going , Wikinews reporters estimated upwards of 200 attended , compared to nearly 700 who had signed up for the event on Facebook .
#Text=Hemp goods were advertised and on sale at the event , and some attendees were seen drinking cannabis-themed energy drinks .

#Text=" I was searched and charged under the Misuse of Drugs Act ( which is a lot of bollocks ) " one attendee noted online , adding " not fair to happen on a brilliant day like it was , other than that I had a great day !
